text: [Music]
good morning guys and welcome to Paris I
arrived here late last night
they flew all the way out from LA
because I've been invited to be part of
a special event where I'm on a panel of
judges for a film festival is the mobile
Film Festival there are open for
submissions from around the world on a
topic of human rights and raising
awareness around human rights so YouTube
creators for Change are hosting it it's
in conjunction with the UN and yeah I
feel really honored to being selected as
one of the panelists that choose which
films win the prizes so the event is
tonight and I've got fifty films to
watch three and that's like the final
selection I think there's like seven
hundred and fifty that was submitted
from around the world and then there's
like prizes going out to I guess like
Best Actor Best Director and best kind
of European winner and then I think I'm
presenting the international award I
guess one of the reasons this is so
important to me is that it's a platform
for anyone in the world to make a short
film to highlight the injustice is going
on in their country so whether it's
centered around kind of racism or
poverty or kind of being attacked from
homophobia people's sexuality child
marriage kind of child slavery just
there's so many issues that have been
tackled here and for me I think YouTube
is this incredible place where people
can share stories and communicate and
reach the ends of the earth with a
message so all of these submissions have
been uploaded onto YouTube there's a
playlist that I'm gonna link below as
well so you can go guys if you one can
see the whole 50 submissions they're
only one minute long beer tonight I
think there's going to be about I guess
like eight prizes or something going out
and
it's it's cool to be a part of something
like this and be supporting something
like this yeah so anyway I'm gonna go
and get some breakfast now um I'm

about this hotel is it's clear swimming
pool in the middle

communicated on the news and there's

we're here to present the grand prize

from Indonesia the LGBTQ community in

about of all of this homophobic things
in Indonesia religion plays such a big

they can be really brutal to this

say really briefly but just what you
shared there I can see the passion that

and it's amazing that we wherever we are
in the world you know what whatever our
passion is that the story that we want
to tell on the injustice that we want to
see kind of addressed we can do that and
we're in the world now where we can do
that and I just want to thank you for
this amazing film and I think it's going
to impact so many people the evening is
over it was pretty amazing to be

right human right violations that

it's it's kind of tough stuff to tackle

it's amazing seeing these kind of small

around these issues and if any of you
guys are filmmakers and
wanting to do this kind of stuff and I
would totally encourage you as I said on

wherever we are in the world whatever

thanks again to YouTube creators for

it with a minute anyway I'm going to
